message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR

This paper deals with the problem of identifying fake news and detecting news influence in a country. It proposes a new method to augment the process of identifying fake news by automating the task of comparing news websites and detecting similarities. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, which fall under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques, as it retrieves text content from websites and compares them. Additionally, the paper deals with social influence and network analysis, which fall under the categories of social informatics (cs.SI) and cybernetics (cs.CY). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of cybersecurity, as it aims to detect fake news and propaganda, which fall under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR).
